info.interactivesystems.gamificationengine.api

Class MarketPlaceApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.interactivesystems.gamificationengine.api.MarketPlaceApi

  • @Path(value="/marketPlace")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public class MarketPlaceApi
extends Object
    The marketplace gives players the opportunity to offer tasks that have to be completed by their colleagues so that they are able to fulfil those tasks and obtain the respective reward. Upon creation of a task, an initial bid in terms of coins is set, which will be obtained as additional reward. Via Bids this initial bid can be raised. To be able to create offers, a marketplace for the organisation is needed. If none exists yet, it first has to be created. If an offer is created an initial bid in terms of coins is set which is obtained by the person who completes it. The initial bid can be raised by other colleagues in order to increase the incentive of fulfilling the task. When a player has completed a Task that belongs to an offer, she/he will obtain all bids as a reward. The particular task is then also added to the player’s list of the finished tasks. All offers a player has put on the marketplace can be requested. The name of an offer can be changed at a later point of time as well as the optional date when an offer ends or the deadline when the associated task of an offer should be done at the latest. At the marketplace not all offers may are visible for each player because the offers can be filtered by the roles a player has. It can also additionally filtered by the date an offer was created or the prize which can be earned. By making a bid, the reward of coins for completing a task is raised. The bidden amount of coins will be subtracted from the bidder’s current account and will be added to the offer’s current prize. Each player can make several bids on condition that her/his coins are enough otherwise the bid cannot be made. It is also possible to get all bids that was made for an offer.

    • Method Detail

      • createMarketPlace

        @POST
 @Path(value="/market")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response createMarketPlace(@QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                   String apiKey)
        Creates a new market place for an organisation which is identified by the API key. So the method generates the marketplace-id. But this is only possible if no marketplace exists yet. The organisation's API key is mandatory otherwise a warning with the hint for a non valid API key is returned.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this marketplace belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of MarketPlace in JSON.

      • deleteMarketPlace

        @DELETE
 @Path(value="/{id}/market")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteMarketPlace(@PathParam(value="id") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The market id must be a valid number")
                                                                                          String marketId,
                                                                                          @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                          String apikey)
        Removes the marketplace with the assigned id from data base. It is checked, if the passed id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned.
        Parameters:
        marketId - Required path parameter as integer which uniquely identify the MarketPlace.
        apikey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this goal belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of MarketPlace in JSON.

      • createNewOffer

        @POST
 @Path(value="/offer")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response createNewOffer(@QueryParam(value="name") @NotNull
                                                                               String name,
                                                                               @QueryParam(value="endDate")
                                                                               String endDate,
                                                                               @QueryParam(value="prize") @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The prize must be a valid number")
                                                                               String prize,
                                                                               @QueryParam(value="taskId") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The task id must be a valid number")
                                                                               String taskId,
                                                                               @QueryParam(value="deadLine")
                                                                               String deadLine,
                                                                               @QueryParam(value="marketId") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The market id must be a valid number")
                                                                               String marketId,
                                                                               @QueryParam(value="playerId") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The player id must be a valid number")
                                                                               String playerId,
                                                                               @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                               String apiKey)
        Creates a new group of offer and so the method generates the offer-id. The organisation's API key is mandatory otherwise a warning with the hint for a non valid API key is returned. By the creation the name, the prize which represents the initial bid and id of the task the offer is associated should be passed. Additionally the id of the player who creates the offer and the id of the marketplace should be passed. Optionally it can be defined when the offer ends and until the task should be done.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the offer. This parameter is required.
        endDate - The date and time how long the offer is available on the market. The format of the values is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm.
        prize - The initial bid of the offer. This is the prize a player can earn.
        taskId - The id of the task the offer is associated with. This parameter is required. // * @param allowedRoles // * Optionally the roles can be passed to indicate who is allowed to fulfil the task and earn the // * prize.
        deadLine - The point of time until the offer is valid. The format of the values is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm.
        marketId - The id of the marketplace where the offer should be available.
        playerId - The id of the player who created the offer. This parameter is required.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this offer belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Offer in JSON.

      • giveABid

        @POST
 @Path(value="/bid")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response giveABid(@QueryParam(value="playerId") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The player id must be a valid number")
                                                                       String playerId,
                                                                       @QueryParam(value="offerId") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The offer id must be a valid number")
                                                                       String offerId,
                                                                       @QueryParam(value="prize") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The player id must be a valid number")
                                                                       String prize,
                                                                       @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                       String apiKey)
        With this method a player makes a bid to an offer. So a new bid is created and therefore an id is generated. The id of the player is needed to indicate who has made the bid and id of the offer to identify for which she/he has bidden. The prize of the bid is needed to add it to the current amount of coins so the offer's prize is raised.
        Parameters:
        playerId - The player who has done the bid. This parameter is required.
        offerId - The offer the player has bidden for. This parameter is required.
        prize - The amount of the bid. This is added to the current prize. This parameter is required.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which the player belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Bid in JSON.

      • getPlayerOffers

        @GET
 @Path(value="/getOffers")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getPlayerOffers(@QueryParam(value="playerId") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The player id must be a valid number")
                                                                                   String playerId,
                                                                                   @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                   String apiKey)
        Gets all offers a specific player has created. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        playerId - The player whose offers are returned.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which the player belongs to.
        Returns:
        A Response as List of Offers in JSON.

      • getOffersByRole

        @GET
 @Path(value="/getOfferRole")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getOffersByRole(@QueryParam(value="playerId") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The player id must be a valid number")
                                                                                      String playerId,
                                                                                      @QueryParam(value="marketPlaceId") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The market id must be a valid number")
                                                                                      String marketPlId,
                                                                                      @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                      String apiKey)
        Gets the allowed offers for a specific player. The player is identified by her/his passed id and API key. The offers are filtered by the roles a player has so only offers are in the returned list which are associated with at least one role a player has. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the ids are a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        playerId - The player whose roles are checked. This parameter is required.
        marketPlId - The marketplace whose offers are filtered.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this player belongs to.
        Returns:
        A Response as List of Offers in JSON.

      • getRecentOffers

        @GET
 @Path(value="/getRecentOffers")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getRecentOffers(@QueryParam(value="playerId") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit
                                                                                         String playerId,
                                                                                         @QueryParam(value="marketPlaceId") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The market id must be a valid number")
                                                                                         String marketPlId,
                                                                                         @QueryParam(value="count") @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The count must be a valid number") @DefaultValue(value="10")
                                                                                         String count,
                                                                                         @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                         String apiKey)
        Gets all available offers for a player ordered by date, recent first. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the player id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        playerId - The player whose roles are checked. This parameter is required.
        marketPlId - The marketplace whose offers are filtered.
        count - Optionally the count of offers that should be returned can be passed. The default value is 10.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which the player belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response as List of Offers in JSON.

        marketPlId - The marketplace whose offers are filtered.

        Returns:
        Response as List of Offers in JSON.

      • deleteOffer

      • completeOffer

        @POST
 @Path(value="/{id}/compOffer")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response completeOffer(@PathParam(value="id") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The id must be a valid number")
                                                                                       String offerId,
                                                                                       @QueryParam(value="playerId") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The player id must be a valid number")
                                                                                       String playerId,
                                                                                       @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                       String apiKey)
        If an offer is fulfilled by a player, this request can be used to complete the offer. With this request the player with the passed id represents the player who fulfilled the task so she/he gets the prize as a reward. It is checked, if all passed ids are a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned.
        Parameters:
        offerId - The offer id which was finished. This parameter is required.
        playerId - The id of the player who has completed the task that was associated with the offer. So she/he earns the prize as a reward.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which this player belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Task in JSON.

      • changeOfferAttributes

        @PUT
 @Path(value="/{id}/attributes")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response changeOfferAttributes(@PathParam(value="id") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The offer id must be a valid number")
                                                                                               String offerId,
                                                                                               @QueryParam(value="attribute") @NotNull
                                                                                               String attribute,
                                                                                               @QueryParam(value="value") @NotNull
                                                                                               String value,
                                                                                               @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                                               String apiKey)
        With this method the fields of an Offer can be changed. For this the id of the offer, the API key of the specific organisation, the name of the field and the new value are needed. To modify the name the new String has to be passed with the attribute field. A new date and time as LocalDateTime for the deadline or enddate can also be passed. The format of these values is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm. A new list of players can be passed when their ids are separated by commas. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the ids are a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        offerId - The id of the offer that should be changed. This parameter is required.
        attribute - The name of the attribute which should be modified. This parameter is required. The following names of attributes can be used to change the associated field: "name", "deadline", "enddate" and "playerRoles".
        value - The new value of the attribute. This parameter is required.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which the offer belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Offer in JSON.

      • deleteBid

        @DELETE
 @Path(value="/{id}/bid")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteBid(@PathParam(value="id") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The id must be a valid number")
                                                                               String bidId,
                                                                               @QueryParam(value="playerId") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The player id must be a valid number")
                                                                               String playerId,
                                                                               @QueryParam(value="offerId") @NotNull @ValidPositiveDigit(message="The offer id must be a valid number")
                                                                               String offerId,
                                                                               @QueryParam(value="apiKey") @ValidApiKey
                                                                               String apiKey)
        Removes the bid with the assigned id from data base. It is checked, if the passed id is a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. If the API key is not valid an analogous message is returned. It is also checked, if the ids are a positive number otherwise a message for an invalid number is returned.
        Parameters:
        bidId - Required path parameter as integer to uniquely identify the bid.
        playerId - The id of the player who has made the bid. This parameter is required.
        offerId - The id of the offer to which the bid is associated.
        apiKey - The valid query parameter API key affiliated to one specific organisation, to which the player belongs to.
        Returns:
        Response of Offer in JSON.
